intro: Mutisia anomala, commonly known as the yellow mutisia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators. Mutisia anomala is often found in tropical and subtropical forests, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
